app.containers.App.app.title: Marine Litter Action Mapping Tool
app.containers.App.actortypes_about.1: Countries and territories that commit to activities or are targeted by activities of other countries and organisations.
app.containers.App.actortypes_about.2: Actors from various sectors conducting relevant activities.
app.containers.App.actortypes_about.3: Country groups that are targeted by specific activities based on classification (e.g. low-income countries).
app.containers.App.actortypes_about.4: Country groups that are targeted by specific activities based on a geographic classification.
app.containers.App.actortypes_about.5: Regional associations of countries with a joint commitment to one or more activities.
app.containers.App.actortypes_about.6: Points and locations of interest (used for Facts & Figures)
app.containers.App.actiontypes_long.3: Regional Marine Litter strategies and frameworks
app.containers.App.actiontypes_long.4: National Marine Litter strategies and frameworks
app.containers.App.actiontypes_about.1: Worldwide programs and projects to support developing and emerging countries to confront the growing problem of marine litter and plastic pollution.
app.containers.App.actiontypes_about.2: Overview of the Regional Seas Conventions, established worldwide with more than 143 participating countries.
app.containers.App.actiontypes_about.3: Regional measures of Intergovernmental Bodies with relevance to marine litter and plastic pollution.
app.containers.App.actiontypes_about.4: Broad overview of different national instruments relevant to combatting marine litter and plastic pollution.
app.containers.App.actiontypes_about.5: Legally binding and voluntary global agreements related to marine litter.
app.containers.App.actiontypes_about.6: Selected actors contributing to the efforts to tackle marine litter and plastic pollution by their general activities.
app.containers.App.actiontypes_info.1: In some cases country memberships/actors are not displayed in international frameworks and policies due to difficulty in retrieving information and potential inconsistencies through updates (e.g. regarding ratifications, etc.).
app.containers.App.actiontypes_info.5: The term **donor** may also include actors that are responsible for conducting the donor activity as **implementing partners**
app.containers.App.resourcetypes_about.1: Principal references for the activities contained in this database.
app.containers.App.resourcetypes_about.4: Action Plans as part of Regional Seas Conventions.
app.containers.App.resourcetypes_about.5: Marine Litter Action Plans as part of Regional Seas Conventions.

No Marine Litter Action Plans yet
app.containers.App.entities.taxonomies.1:
This category shows the status of each Convention within the UN system, most notably what stages of the ratification process the Convention has undergone so far.  

 _We do not take responsibility for the complete accuracy of the legal information provided._
app.containers.App.entities.taxonomies.2:
There are different possible forms of administration for agreements concluded within the UN institutional system. This category aims to make it clear how and by whom each agreement portrayed in our tool is administered.  

 _We do not take responsibility for the complete accuracy of the legal information provided._
app.containers.App.entities.taxonomies.3:
This category shows whether the various land-based sources (LBS) protocols portrayed in this tool have already entered into force or not. 

 _We do not take responsibility for the complete accuracy of the legal information provided._
app.containers.App.entities.taxonomies.4: No strategy type issue assigned yet

This category denotates the main aims of the policy initiatives, legislative and political action examined in this tool. The categories were designed based on pre-existing expertise and iteratively adapted to the data at hand.
app.containers.App.entities.taxonomies.6: No type of organisation assigned yet
This category denotates the composition of intergovernmental organisations. The intergovernmental organisations whose engagement is shown in our tool consist almost exclusively of states.
app.containers.App.entities.taxonomies.7: Institutions are classified according to the sector from which they emerge. Each sector is driven by a different logic, ownership etc.
app.containers.App.entities.taxonomies.8: No type of organisation assigned yet
For categorising organisations by type within a given economic sector
app.containers.App.entities.taxonomies.9: No type of classification assigned yet
app.containers.App.entities.taxonomies.1: For categorising countries by country status

When concluding international agreements, states do not always show the same amount of commitment. The commitment level shows what degree of sovereignty states are willing to give up and in what way a new agreement intersects with pre-existing frameworks and instruments. 

 _We do not take responsibility for the complete accuracy of the legal information provided._

Various forms of (international) cooperation portrayed in our tool. Commitment types show the different forms of coordination and cooperation between actors in the field of marine litter and plastic pollution. 

 _We do not take responsibility for the complete accuracy of the legal information provided._

Countries ordered into regions of differing geographical features (e.g. land and sea regions) and differing recognition by various actors (e.g. corresponding to a Regional Sea Convention or to donor activities). 

 _The categories used are for informational purposes only and do not constitute recognition of international boundaries or regions; GIZ makes no claims concerning the validity, accuracy or completeness of the tags and portrayed maps nor assumes any liability resulting from the use of the information therein._
To allow categorise donor activities, specifically mark them as 'pilot projects'
